subject: assertTrue
msgSnippet: I just moved up to JUnit 3.7, and I m beginning to convert existing code to use assertTrue instead of assert. Does anyone else find it odd to write something
messageBody:
I just moved up to JUnit 3.7, and I'm beginning to convert existing code
to use assertTrue instead of assert.

Does anyone else find it odd to write something like:

assertTrue(!someCondition);

I had no problem with assert(!someCondition), but it reads funny with
assertTrue().

Would it make sense to add a corresponding assertFalse(someCondition) to
JUnit? I know it is redundant in a sense, but I think it would
communicate better.

Randy
--
Randy Coulman
Senior Software Engineer
Key Technology, Inc.
